Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
Gauntlet.description: This metal glove lets you deal lethal damage rather than nonlethal damage with unarmed strikes. A strike with a gauntlet is otherwise considered an unarmed attack. The cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet. Medium and heavy armors (except breastplate) come with gauntlets.

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.description: You get a +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks made to conceal a dagger on your body (see the Sleight of Hand skill).

Gauntlet, spiked.name: Gauntlet, spiked
Gauntlet, spiked.description: Your opponent cannot use a disarm action to disarm you of spiked gauntlets. The cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet. An attack with a spiked gauntlet is considered an armed attack.

Mace, light.name: Mace, light
Mace, light.description: A light mace is used by heroes that want to defend themselves, but would rather not sever limbs or see a lot of blood otherwise.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.description: A sickle can be used to make trip attacks. If you are tripped during your own trip attempt, you can drop the sickle to avoid being tripped.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: This is basically a sturdy stick.

Mace, heavy.name: Mace, heavy
Mace, heavy.description: This is a larger sized mace, a bit heavier than the light version. A bit harder to swing, but packs a slightly harder punch.

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.description: This wicked looking club is jagged. The small spikes help to dent armor and crack bones.

Shortspear.name: Shortspear
Shortspear.description: A shortspear is small enough to wield one-handed. It may also be thrown.

Longspear.name: Longspear
Longspear.description: A longspear has reach. You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you cant use it against an adjacent foe. If you use a ready action to set a longspear against a charge, you deal double damage on a successful hit against a charging character.

Quarterstaff.name: Quarterstaff
Quarterstaff.description: A quarterstaff is a double weapon. You can fight with it as if fighting with two weapons, but if you do, you incur all the normal attack penalties associated with fighting with two weapons, just as if you were using a one-handed weapon and a light weapon. A creature wielding a quarterstaff in one hand cant use it as a double weapon-only one end of the weapon can be used in any given round.

Spear.name: Spear
Spear.description: This spear is too long for single handed us, but short enough to not be unwieldy.

Crossbow, heavy.name: Crossbow, heavy
Crossbow, heavy.description: You draw a heavy crossbow back by turning a small winch. Loading a heavy crossbow is a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity.

Crossbow, light.name: Crossbow, light
Crossbow, light.description: You draw a light crossbow back by pulling a lever. Loading a light crossbow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity.

Dart.name: Dart
Dart.description: Darts are not particularly lethal, but in the right hands, can be thrown with deadly intent.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.description: Since it is not designed for melee, you are treated as nonproficient with it and take a -4 penalty on attack rolls if you use a javelin as a melee weapon.

Sling.name: Sling
Sling.description: Your Strength modifier applies to damage rolls when you use a sling, just as it does for thrown weapons. You can fire, but not load, a sling with one hand. Loading a sling is a move action that requires two hands and provokes attacks of opportunity.

Axe.name: Axe
Axe.description: Great for chopping logs, and limbs.

Hammer, light.name: Hammer, light
Hammer, light.description: Great for whacking nails and cracking skulls.

Handaxe.name: Handaxe
Handaxe.description: The 'hatchet' sized axe, can both chop with the best of them and be thrown at a close range.

Kukri.name: Kukri
Kukri.description: The kukri is a multiuse blade that is great for clearing out brush and overgrown, while also serving as a great weapon.

Pick, light.name: Pick, light
Pick, light.description: Any digger worth their weight in ore, would always we equipped with a light pick. If it can break up rock, think what it can do to flesh.

Sap.name: Sap
Sap.description: Whack a fool in the head, and knock him out. This weapon is great for dealing non-fatal blows.

Sword, short.name: Sword, short
Sword, short.description: This sword is rough the lenght of an arm. It's easy to wield, and a skilled fighter might even be able to dual wield these.

Battleaxe.name: Battleaxe
Battleaxe.description: This axe is designed for the fight. It can chop wood, no doubt, but shines covered in blood.

Flail.name: Flail
Flail.description: With a flail, you get a +2 bonus on opposed attack rolls made to disarm an enemy (including the roll to avoid being disarmed if such an attempt fails).

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description: The longsword is a favorite of a warrior that dons a shield. It grants them a bit more reach when swinging from behind their protection.

Pick, heavy.name: Pick, heavy
Pick, heavy.description: This pick, like the light version, is great for digging in rock and gravel, but can make a deadly weapon nonetheless.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: You can use the Weapon Finesse feat to apply your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier to attack rolls with a rapier sized for you, even though it isnt a light weapon for you. You cant wield a rapier in two hands in order to apply 1.5 times your Strength bonus to damage.

Scimitar.name: Scimitar
Scimitar.description: This sword may look delicate, it is quite capable of trading blows with most weapons, but fast enough to find its way around them as well.

Trident.name: Trident
Trident.description: This weapon can be thrown. If you use a ready action to set a trident against a charge, you deal double damage on a successful hit against a charging character.

Warhammer.name: Warhammer
Warhammer.description: This hammer is not for building, rather for smashing. Swing this weapon when you want to crack bones.

Falchion.name: Falchion
Falchion.description: This bladeside heavy sword is great for long swooping strokes that cut ememies to ribbons.

Glaive.name: Glaive
Glaive.description: A glaive has reach. You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you cant use it against an adjacent foe.

Greataxe.name: Greataxe
Greataxe.description: The 'big daddy' axe is heavy and cumbersome, but is take off a head in a single swing.

Greatclub.name: Greatclub
Greatclub.description: If you have the strength to pick this up, you can really smash your way through your enemies.

Flail, heavy.name: Flail, heavy
Flail, heavy.description: With a flail, you get a +2 bonus on opposed attack rolls made to disarm an enemy (including the roll to avoid being disarmed if such an attempt fails).

Greatsword.name: Greatsword
Greatsword.description: This is a big blade indeed. No shorter than 6' this blade is long and heavy, but it's thirsty for blood.

Guisarme.name: Guisarme
Guisarme.description: A guisarme has reach. You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you cant use it against an adjacent foe.

Halberd.name: Halberd
Halberd.description: If you use a ready action to set a halberd against a charge, you deal double damage on a successful hit against a charging character.

Lance.name: Lance
Lance.description: A lance deals double damage when used from the back of a charging mount. It has reach, so you can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you cant use it against an adjacent foe.

Ranseur.name: Ranseur
Ranseur.description: A ranseur has reach. You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you cant use it against an adjacent foe.

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: A scythe can be used to make trip attacks. If you are tripped during your own trip attempt, you can drop the scythe to avoid being tripped.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size. A longbow is too unwieldy to use while you are mounted. If you have a penalty for low Strength, apply it to damage rolls when you use a longbow. If you have a bonus for high Strength, you can apply it to damage rolls when you use a composite longbow (see below) but not a regular longbow.

Longbow, composite.name: Longbow, composite
Longbow, composite.description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size. You can use a composite longbow while mounted. All composite bows are made with a particular strength rating (that is, each requires a minimum Strength modifier to use with proficiency). If your Strength bonus is less than the strength rating of the composite bow, you cant effectively use it, so you take a -2 penalty on attacks with it. The default composite longbow requires a Strength modifier of +0 or higher to use with proficiency. A composite longbow can be made with a high strength rating to take advantage of an above-average Strength score; this feature allows you to add your Strength bonus to damage, up to the maximum bonus indicated for the bow. Each point of Strength bonus granted by the bow adds 100 gp to its cost.

Shortbow.name: Shortbow
Shortbow.description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size. You can use a shortbow while mounted. If you have a penalty for low Strength, apply it to damage rolls when you use a shortbow. If you have a bonus for high Strength, you can apply it to damage rolls when you use a composite shortbow (see below) but not a regular shortbow.

Shortbow, composite.name: Shortbow, composite
Shortbow, composite.description: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size. You can use a composite shortbow while mounted. All composite bows are made with a particular strength rating (that is, each requires a minimum Strength modifier to use with proficiency). If your Strength bonus is lower than the strength rating of the composite bow, you cant effectively use it, so you take a -2 penalty on attacks with it. The default composite shortbow requires a Strength modifier of +0 or higher to use with proficiency. A composite shortbow can be made with a high strength rating to take advantage of an above-average Strength score; this feature allows you to add your Strength bonus to damage, up to the maximum bonus indicated for the bow. Each point of Strength bonus granted by the bow adds 75 gp to its cost.

Kama.name: Kama
Kama.description: The kama is a special monk weapon. This designation gives a monk wielding a kama special options.

Nunchaku.name: Nunchaku
Nunchaku.description: The nunchaku is a special monk weapon. This designation gives a monk wielding a nunchaku special options. With a nunchaku, you get a +2 bonus on opposed attack rolls made to disarm an enemy (including the roll to avoid being disarmed if such an attempt fails).

Sai.name: Sai
Sai.description: With a sai, you get a +4 bonus on opposed attack rolls made to disarm an enemy (including the roll to avoid being disarmed if such an attempt fails).

Siangham.name: Siangham
Siangham.description: The siangham is a special monk weapon. This designation gives a monk wielding a siangham special options.

Sword, bastard.name: Sword, bastard
Sword, bastard.description: A bastard sword is too large to use in one hand without special training; thus, it is an exotic weapon. A character can use a bastard sword two-handed as a martial weapon.

Waraxe, dwarven.name: Waraxe, dwarven
Waraxe, dwarven.description: A dwarven waraxe is too large to use in one hand without special training; thus, it is an exotic weapon. A Medium character can use a dwarven waraxe two-handed as a martial weapon, or a Large creature can use it one-handed in the same way. A dwarf treats a dwarven waraxe as a martial weapon even when using it in one hand.

Axe, orc double.name: Axe, orc double
Axe, orc double.description: An orc double axe is a double weapon. You can fight with it as if fighting with two weapons, but if you do, you incur all the normal attack penalties associated with fighting with two weapons, just as if you were using a one-handed weapon and a light weapon.

Chain, spiked.name: Chain, spiked
Chain, spiked.description: A spiked chain has reach, so you can strike opponents 10 feet away with it. In addition, unlike most other weapons with reach, it can be used against an adjacent foe.

Flail, dire.name: Flail, dire
Flail, dire.description: A dire flail is a double weapon. You can fight with it as if fighting with two weapons, but if you do, you incur all the normal attack penalties associated with fighting with two weapons, just as if you were using a one-handed weapon and a light weapon. A creature wielding a dire flail in one hand cant use it as a double weapon- only one end of the weapon can be used in any given round.

Crossbow, hand.name: Crossbow, hand
Crossbow, hand.description: You can draw a hand crossbow back by hand. Loading a hand crossbow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity.

Crossbow, repeating heavy.name: Crossbow, repeating heavy
Crossbow, repeating heavy.description: The repeating crossbow (whether heavy or light) holds 5 crossbow bolts. As long as it holds bolts, you can reload it by pulling the reloading lever (a free action). Loading a new case of 5 bolts is a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity.

Crossbow, repeating light.name: Crossbow, repeating light
Crossbow, repeating light.description: The repeating crossbow (whether heavy or light) holds 5 crossbow bolts. As long as it holds bolts, you can reload it by pulling the reloading lever (a free action). Loading a new case of 5 bolts is a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity.
